message.content:
Oxalis corniculata is a small, herbaceous plant that belongs to the family of Oxalidaceae. 
It has a prostrate and spreading growth habit and can grow up to 30 cm in height. 
The plant has trifoliate leaves that are bright green in color and have a heart-shaped configuration. 
Oxalis corniculata flowers are yellow in color and have five petals, with each petal measuring approximately 8 mm in length. 
The plant produces small, pointed seedpods that are about 1 cm long and split open to release the small, almond-shaped seeds. 
Oxalis corniculata is used in traditional medicine as a remedy for various ailments, including inflammation, infections and digestive problems. 
It is commonly found in gardens, lawns, and other places with moist and well-drained soil, thriving in both sunny and partially-shaded areas.
